div.h2: Welcome to Perry Community School District To develop knowledgeable, skilled, and productive citizens of character.

span.strong: Online Registration for the 20-21 school year will be available Tuesday, April 21st and 12:00 pm. All new and returning students will be able to register online for classes beginning August 2020. The links will be available below.

a.title: Children no longer have to be present

span.a: Meal Information Update - Children no longer have to be present - Click for details

br.br: Do you have questions for our district management team? Click here to submit a question and we will provide answers.

strong.span: Iowa Core End of Year Expectations

br.br:
The Iowa Core Parent Guides, in English and Spanish, were developed to provide an overview of what students will learn by the end of each grade level as directed by the Iowa Core, our statewide academic standards.
A guide was developed for each grade level kindergarten through grade 8 and one for high school students. The guides include a brief overview of what will be learned in each subject area in the Iowa Core, examples of what your child's work at school may look like, and examples of how you can help your child at home.
Access the guide here.

hr.br:
During this time, if you are finding a need to talk through anything, the resources below can be helpful during this time.
Here are mental health resources:
- Please Pass the Love Resources
- Managing Fears and Anxiety around Coronavirus
- List of Personal Things You Can Do to Stay Well in a Time of CoVID-19
- CDC's Mental Health & COVID-19 Secondary Traumatic Stress and Self-Care Packet
About PCSD
Perry Community School District is located approximately 25 miles northwest of Des Moines. Serving approximately 1,800 students, our diversity, community support and size, make Perry a great place to raise a family. A tradition of excellence combined witha small town feelprovides endless opportunities. Welcome!

div.span:
It is the policy of the Perry Community School District not to illegally discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, gender, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the districts Equity Coordinator, Angelica Cardenas, 1200 18th Street, Perry, IA 50220-1650, (515) 465-3505, or to the Director of the Region VII Office of Civil Rights, Department of Education, Chicago, IL. Questions about ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) compliance may be directed to Laura Skeel, ADA Coordinator, (515) 465-5656. Click here to email Angelica.Cardenas@perry.k12.ia.us
The Perry Community School District offers career and technical programs in the following areas of study: Agriculture, Food and Natural Resources, Information Solutions, Applied Sciences, Technology, Engineering, and Manufacturing, Health Sciences, Human Services, and Business, Finance, Marketing and Management.
